verbs.description: predeclare (third-person singular simple present predeclares, present participle predeclaring, simple past and past participle predeclared)

examples: their indefeasible power of predeclaring the eternal destiny of every living layman

entries.meaning: (transitive, programming) To declare some source code element (such as a class) in advance of its full description, so that other preceding parts of the code can refer to it.
